timeline.bodyText: How do we know that the new parm took affect?
timeline.author: loriadi

timeline.bodyText: I don't think changing the config is enough.  You should prove that the element worked, and then prove it stopped working after removing it.
timeline.author: loriadi

timeline.bodyText: This seems identical to the existing gprc.client.xml file, might not need it?
timeline.author: loriadi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@
+<!--
+    Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+    All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+    are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+    which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+    http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+   
+    Contributors:
+        IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+ -->
+<server description="FAT configuration for gRPC Client with no grpcTarget elements">
+    <featureManager>
+        <feature>grpcClient-1.0</feature>
+    </featureManager>
+
+	<httpEndpoint id="defaultHttpEndpoint"
+                  host="*"
+                  httpPort="${bvt.prop.HTTP_secondary}"
+                  httpsPort="${bvt.prop.HTTP_secondary.secure}"/>
+    
+    <include location="../fatTestCommon.xml"/>
+   
+    <javaPermission className="java.security.AllPermission"  name="*" actions="*" />
+</server>

timeline.bodyText: Going by the comment, I'd expect this test to check for an error case.  If you set a very small max inbound message size and request a response that's larger than that value, will it give an error?  This test case as it's written doesn't test that since us3r1 is less than 16 bytes.
timeline.author: wtlucy

replies.bodyText: Ooops, meant to circle back to that test after I got the others working and forgot.  I'll have it fixed up momentarily.
replies.author: epj
